meanings.definition: The state of being empty or unoccupied.
meanings.sent1: The vacantnesses of the room made it feel cold and lonely.
meanings.sent2: The vacantnesses of the parking lot indicated it was closed for the night.
meanings.sent3: The vacantnesses of the fridge was a mystery until they found out the power was out.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes held a vacantnesses that hinted at hidden sorrow.
meanings.sent5: The vacantnesses of the desert stretched endlessly under the scorching sun.

meanings.definition: The quality of lacking content or substance.
meanings.sent1: The vacantnesses of his promises left her feeling disappointed.
meanings.sent2: The vacantnesses of the book made it hard to stay interested.
meanings.sent3: The vacantnesses of the soup was so extreme that it was basically just colored water.
meanings.sent4: His speech was full of vacantnesses, lacking any real meaning or depth.
meanings.sent5: The vacantnesses of the argument made it clear they were just talking in circles.
